node.text:
The air quality lately has been ROUGH to say the least🥴...If you live in the Pacific Northwest, or frankly anywhere in the country right now, then you’re likely experiencing it. Freakonomics Radio even released a recent podcast about how air pollution is linked to cognitive decline. Yikes.

Aside from avoiding being outside on days like these, I’ve been adding a few extra tidbits to my wellness routine, Mullein tea being one of them! Mullein is a medicinal herb and lung tonic that has been used for years as an ancient form of medicine🌱...and it grows like gangbusters all over my property. You can even blend it with loose-leaf tobacco to take some of the “edge” off harsh pipe or tobacco smoke.

👉🏼I’m also doubling down on @ancestralsupplements desiccated lung supplement, with the idea that “like supports like” and certain organs, when consumed, help certain body functions related to that organ.

Aside from doing all my usual practices to support my detox pathways, I’ve also been using my BioCharger👀. The BioCharger is a biohacking device I’ve been using for years for its ‘recipes’ such as sleep onset, relaxation, athletic recovery, and hypoxia in this case.

⚡️The BioCharger utilizes four different energy types —light, voltage, frequencies and harmonics, and pulsed electromagnetic fields (PEMFs).

Sound foreign to you? Well, I recorded a podcast episode that goes in deep on the technology behind this incredible device.

Click the link in my bio to dive in! I’d also love to hear from you? How do you care for your lungs when air pollution is bad?

node.text:
❄️Who loves cold baths? Or at least, who has the classic love-hate relationship with ‘em?

I personally integrate cold therapy into my daily routine for several reasons (and have for nearly 20 years, since my days as a chilly open water swimmer and triathlete), including: 
👉🏼 Boosted metabolism
👉🏼 Enhanced immune function
👉🏼 Better vagal nerve tone
👉🏼 Creation of metabolically active brown fat
👉🏼 Improved cardiovascular fitness
👉🏼 Elevated mood & focus (like a full body cup o’ coffee!)

Anyways, I have a @morozkoforge set up at my house that I keep at around 32 degrees (this bad boy is self cleaning and maintains super cold temps even in high heat summer conditions).👉🏼In this video, I share some tips and tricks for plunging without over-activating your nervous system or turning yourself into a hyperventilating freak-out fest.

😆If you're not sure where to start when it comes to integrating cold therapy into your routine, then I've ALSO got a cool (hehe) opportunity for you to learn everything you need to know about cold thermogenesis👇🏼. 

My company @kion has officially kicked off their Cold Thermo Challenge! By signing up for the challenge, you’ll learn everything you need to know from experts in cold therapy so you can practice it safely and effectively.👏🏼You'll also automatically enter for a chance to win a bundle of prizes which includes a signed copy of my book, Boundless. 

💥Click the link in my bio to take the plunge, and join thousands of others. How about you? Do you even cold plunge, bro? 😉

node.text:
😁I’m going to tell you a few things you might not know about my new Boundless Cookbook (Including the thousands and thousands of dollars spent in a test kitchen to make sure all the recipes are just perfect).

👉🏼Enjoy this quick video, and if you didn’t get the book yet, it’s now available on Amazon, and also on BoundlessCookbook.com (click the link in my bio).

If you already got yourself a copy and you’re enjoying the mouthwatering goodness within, please be so kind as to leave the book a review on Amazon🙏🏼. That is so, so helpful for getting the word out and helping thousands of people around the world and their families to eat healthy and enjoy doing it!

By the way, I’m curious to hear from you… What is your all-time favorite meal to prepare, or what would you eat, for example, if you had to take one thing to a desert island for the rest of your life👇🏼?

node.text: The Hapbee device is at http://www.bengreenfieldfitness.com/hapbee and simulates nicotine, cbd, caffeine, adenosine, melatonin and much more…and now…theobromine feel good chemicals from CHOCOLATE! Use the link above to get an $80 discount.

node.title: Ben shows how he wears chocolate signals around his neck.

node.text:
📖I’m often asked how I use my Spiritual Disciplines Journal. The journal is how I start and end each day in prayer and reflection 🙏🏼

In this video I detail my personal journaling routine. Click the link in my bio for a step-by-step guide on this routine!

💥And I’d love to hear from you. What does your morning and evening spiritual routine look like? Feel free to share below in the comments

node.text:
In fact, there are exercises that are more than 2,500 years old that promised "vigor and virility" to teachers of Tibetan Buddhism👀.

I've come across principles and practices like this in my reading and interviews, but I never really systematized them, put them into practice, or wove them into my daily routine.

Until now💥!

I've been weaving these energy movements into my own morning "stretch" routine, along with a handful of other exercises borrowed from practices such as Tai Chi and Qi Gong😁.

This simple 15-minute morning energy routine works like gangbusters for a noticeable uptick in energy throughout the day (to the point where you shouldn't be surprised if you suddenly develop the vigor, drive, and vitality of a sixteen-year-old!)💪🏼.

👉🏼In today's article, you'll learn more about the movements in this video and you'll receive a downloadable guide reference to help you optimize your own daily energy through movement and breath.

Click the link in my bio to access the full article! And I'd love to hear from you. Are you going to try this morning routine? Do you have a go-to energy-enhancing routine? Feel free to comment below. I'd love to hear from you👇🏼.

node.title: ⚡️The Best “Fountain Of Youth” Energy Routine I’ve Ever Done⚡️

node.text:
This recipe is a “biohacked”, simplified way to amplify the flavor of any stew meat or roast meat😋. It’s a fast and easy way to feed yourself or the whole family for days, since the stew tastes even better in the days after it cooks!
 
👉🏼Braising the meat with maple syrup and vinegar gives the roast plenty of time to get fall-apart tender while all that flavor sinks deep into the meat!

💥As a bonus, the braising liquid reduces to a thick, concentrated sauce to pour over the meat on your plate and add extra flavor to the caramelized vegetables as well.
 
The “secret sauces” are a few I use in other recipes within the brand new Boundless Cookbook👉🏼: namely grass-fed, grass-finished beef and bacon from @belcampomeatco meats, @kettleandfire organic bone broth, the antioxidant rich @Organifi red juice powder, a touch of organic @joeyshotsauce Sauce, the incredible, antioxidant rich Himalayan Tartary Buckwheat flour and equally anti-oxidant rich @FourSigmatic Chaga mushroom extract, Fresh Pressed Olive Oil club extra virgin olive oil, and a bit of the incredibly flavorful @avajaneskitchen salt from the Mexican coast.
 
😁Finally, as an optional add-on, for an incredibly even cook with no “hotspots”, I like to cook with my dutch pot and vegetables on the @traegergrills , although an oven will also do!
 
Click the link in my bio for this full recipe💥!
 
I’ve also partnered up with all the brands featured above for a massive giveaway with over $4,000 worth in prizes.⚡️You have to pre-order my cookbook to be eligible to win! Click the link in my bio to enter or visit BoundlessCookbook.com😁

node.text:
The air quality lately has been ROUGH to say the least🥴...If you live in the Pacific Northwest, or frankly anywhere in the country right now, then you’re likely experiencing it. Freakonomics Radio even released a recent podcast about how air pollution is linked to cognitive decline. Yikes.

Aside from avoiding being outside on days like these, I’ve been adding a few extra tidbits to my wellness routine, Mullein tea being one of them! Mullein is a medicinal herb and lung tonic that has been used for years as an ancient form of medicine🌱...and it grows like gangbusters all over my property. You can even blend it with loose-leaf tobacco to take some of the “edge” off harsh pipe or tobacco smoke.

👉🏼I’m also doubling down on @ancestralsupplements desiccated lung supplement, with the idea that “like supports like” and certain organs, when consumed, help certain body functions related to that organ.

Aside from doing all my usual practices to support my detox pathways, I’ve also been using my BioCharger👀. The BioCharger is a biohacking device I’ve been using for years for its ‘recipes’ such as sleep onset, relaxation, athletic recovery, and hypoxia in this case.

⚡️The BioCharger utilizes four different energy types —light, voltage, frequencies and harmonics, and pulsed electromagnetic fields (PEMFs).

Sound foreign to you? Well, I recorded a podcast episode that goes in deep on the technology behind this incredible device.

Click the link in my bio to dive in! I’d also love to hear from you? How do you care for your lungs when air pollution is bad?

node.text:
Do you ever find yourself experiencing FOMO (fear of missing out)? Or constantly grasping for a new activity or new device to try out in constant overwhelm👀?

😬I've been there... And I've found that there are two ways to avoid feelings of overwhelm and FOMO:

👉🏼Knowing your purpose and taking the time to reflect on whether or not you are spending a majority of your time living out your purpose every day

👉🏼 Embracing the idea and belief that you are going to live forever and that heaven is a perfect version of this earth that we live in 

💥As a result of this belief, you can remind yourself whenever you are bombarded with new opportunities that you have infinity to do whatever you want you to do. Knowing this, you'll feel a greater sense of presence and attention to doing what matters most to you in every moment of every day.

So, if ***you were going to live forever***, what would you focus most of your energy on now👇🏼?

I discuss this - and many other deep topics - in detail in my latest podcast episode with @aubreymarcus . Click the link in my bio to dive into this insightful conversation.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Ben Greenfield Fitness on August 18, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and body of water.

node.text:
Here's the nerdy 14-year-old me🤓! 

I played violin🎻 for 13 years.

I was president of the chess♟ club.

📖By the time I was 13 years old, I had written an entire fantasy fiction novel that my brother somehow deleted from my computer, an experience that left me in the throes of despair for months on end.

I painted watercolor for hours on end🎨.

I read books just about as frequently as I do now, typically about 4-7 books every week👀.

👉🏼But as you can see, I also loved the outdoors and physical culture. I've somehow woven all of that together into my life today... being a nerd/geek, reading, writing, teaching, music, and the great outdoors. 

"That thing that made you weird as a kid could make you great as an adult — if you don’t lose it." -Kevin Kelly

So...what things did you like to do when you were a kid that shaped you into the person you are now👇🏼?

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Ben Greenfield Fitness on August 17, 2021 tagging @elementhealth. May be an image of text.

node.text:
I can't say I don't do drugs😳…
 
…but my drug use looks nothing like what you might be thinking.
 
See, I have quite an interest in substances with health-enhancing benefits and I thoroughly enjoy playing around with different ways to optimize cognition, improve mood, and aid in workout recovery, including CBD🌱.
 
First things first: CBD is not weed❌. And the evidence that CBD is a powerful health enhancer is indisputable, which is why I have written and podcasted on it extensively in the past. 
 
👉🏼However, I continue to get CBD-related questions in response to the many articles and posts I have made on it in the past. So, I compiled a list of the most frequently asked questions I've received about CBD and asked my dear friend Adam Wenguer of @Elementhealth if he'd help with the answers.
 
💥Click the link in my bio to dive into the full article answering all your pressing questions on CBD. I'd also love to hear from you. Do you use CBD? If so, what has your experience been like?

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Ben Greenfield Fitness on August 16, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, standing, indoor and text that says 'VASPER'.

node.text:
💪🏼High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT), when done right (hard when it’s time to go hard, easy when it’s time to go easy) is truly one of the most effective ways to increase mitochondrial density.

👉🏼Something as simple as 3 rounds of 30 second all-out efforts 2-3 times a week is enough (though surprisingly short) to increase mitochondrial density. That increase in mitochondrial density ultimately leads to more oxidative enzymes, giving you a higher capacity to go longer and harder in your workouts.

However, to reap all the benefits of HIIT, you have to emphasize short spurts of exercise, volume moderation (AKA, don't go hard for hours on end) and recovery👀. 

🤓The latest research shows that bouts of HIIT do exactly what you want it to do to the body, but you need to provide a period of ’de-training’. Don’t beat yourself up for longer than 4 weeks maximum without integrating a de-load week. Recovery and periods of 'de-training' are essential components of reaping the benefits from this type of training. 

I discuss all this in detail in my latest Q&A podcast, along with how to stop being a people pleaser, secrets to achieving longevity, and much more🧐! 

💥Click the link in my bio to dive into this episode. I'd also love to hear from you. How do you incorporate HIIT into your workout routine while also emphasizing recovery? Or do you NOT do it based on other factors?

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Ben Greenfield Fitness on August 15, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says '"What have you learned from your own injuries or illnesses? How have you grown, or how have you resisted growth and instead grit your teeth to stay attached to a fading or failing part of you?" @BENGREENFIELDFITNESS'.

node.text:
𝐈 𝐫𝐞𝐜𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐥𝐲 𝐡𝐚𝐝 𝐚 𝐛𝐢𝐭 𝐨𝐟 𝐚 𝐡𝐞𝐚𝐥𝐭𝐡 𝐬𝐜𝐚𝐫𝐞👀.

See, my knee has been bugging me in a strange way lately.

👉🏼Considering I have competed since I was 14 years old at a pretty intense level, I feel like I've actually kept myself pretty well put together from an injury standpoint—with zero major surgeries and no injuries that I haven't resolved within a matter of weeks.

But it seemed to me, over the past few months, that I'd finally "met my match" with this knee😬. And when I finally went to the doctor, the findings were concerning.

In today's article, I share what happened with my knee, how I have learned to cope with adversity, and how difficult circumstances can lead to significant personal growth.

Click the link in my bio to dive in💥. 

What about you? What have you learned from your own injuries or illnesses? How have you grown, or how have you resisted growth and instead grit your teeth to stay attached to a fading or failing part of you? Feel free to share in the comments below.

node.text:
𝐎𝐫𝐠𝐚𝐧 𝐦𝐞𝐚𝐭𝐬 𝐚𝐫𝐞 𝐭𝐫𝐮𝐥𝐲 𝐨𝐧𝐞 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐦𝐨𝐬𝐭 𝐧𝐮𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐭-𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐬𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐨𝐝𝐬 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐩𝐥𝐚𝐧𝐞𝐭🥩.

Yep, organ meat! I’m talking liver, heart, suet, and everything in between. In fact, I’d go as far as to call organ meat a far more superior ‘superfood’ than any of the plant-based foods that claim to be. Organ meats are particularly good sources of B-vitamins, such as B-12 and folate. 

And when you think about it, there’s a solid ethical and environmental argument for eating an entire animal “nose-to-tail” rather than just eating the muscle meat😉.

Pictured above is one of my favorite recipes: Beef, Liver, And Onions😋. 

Simple, elegant, tasty and a perfect way to enjoy organ meats and swear you’re eating at a fancy steakhouse, or at least, an elegant cowboy campfire feed (with some darn healthy cowboys!).

📖My brand new Boundless Cookbook features this exact recipe and a whole entire section dedicated to organ meat! And guess what? The cookbook is now available on Amazon and Kindle. Click the link in my bio to get your hands on a copy!

Do you incorporate organ meats into your diet? If so, how? Feel free to comment below👇🏼.

node.text:
I'm fascinated with spiritual, medicinal, and little-known aspects of the plant kingdom🌱…

…which is what I discussed in-depth on my recent podcast with Sajah Popham.

📖Sajah is the author of the book Evolutionary Herbalism: Science, Spirituality, and Medicine from the Heart of Nature, which weaves together herbal and medical traditions from around the world into a singular cohesive model.

Sajah Popham's mission is to share knowledge, tools, and medicine that promote the healing power of plants —to not just heal our bodies of disease, but to assist in the evolution of human consciousness back into its natural state👀.

During today's podcast, Part 2 of my discussion with Sajah, you'll discover:
👉🏼 How specific plant parts correspond to different elements
👉🏼 How each of us has different elemental "types"
👉🏼 How we might design our lives based on our elemental types

Click the link in my bio to dive into this conversation!

node.text:
Throwback Thursday👀. 

My Dad used to rock what I'd say is a pretty healthy-looking beard - and that’s him around 50 years old. 

👉🏼As many of you know, I am still on my own hair growth journey. I have recorded a few podcasts and written a few articles on what I've been trying out to maximize my hair and beard growth. Click the link in my bio for some of those resources, along with an amazing podcast about water with my Dad (Gary Greenfield).

But even more importantly, what do you think? Do I look like my dad? A chip off the old block? Is my beard getting close to being as luscious as his?

node.text:
This right here is one of my unique go-to meat rubs that uses a superfood blend called @organifi Red Juice Powder🥩. This powder is chock-full of nutrient dense ingredients like beetroot powder, cordyceps, reishi mushroom, rhodiola, and more - but who ever thought it made a melt-in-your-mouth meat rub too?

I mix this powder into water and smoothies all the time, but a little while back, I decided to get creative and play around with using it as a steak rub😆…. And boy, I am thankful that I did! Since it is jam-packed with flavor on its own, it really doesn’t need too much else. All I do is add in coarse salt, cayenne pepper, black pepper, and mix it all up. It caramelizes and flavors the meat quite nicely. 

👉🏼In my brand new Boundless Cookbook, I have an entire section dedicated to the unique, little-known meat rubs I use on rotation. As someone who eats a modified carnivore diet, I take my meat rubs pretty seriously, and am constantly on the hunt for new herbs and spices that pair well with meat.

💥Click the link in my bio to get your copy of my new cookbook (and it's now available on Amazon)! How about you? What is your secret weapon for making a delicious meat rub?

node.text:
If you're anything like me, you may drink moderately and within reason, yet still occasionally need to deal with a hangover or blah-morning symptoms if you're not careful🥴. This is why in my coverage of drinking on my blog and podcast, I have placed a good deal of focus on mitigating the morning-after effects and other side effects of alcohol and ibuprofen. 

👉🏼Most people reach for that ibuprofen or acetaminophen, or a greasy mess of scrambled eggs, to power through the day after drinking, but that just compounds the burden on your liver and gut and is a quick-fix approach! 

While there is still a whole lot to be learned, the research on alcohol is conclusive on this point👉🏼: drinking to excess is dangerous, and it's a significant societal problem, while moderate use of alcohol seems to be life extending!

Even the Bible speaks favorably of using wine for medicinal purposes and advises to “drink your wine with a cheerful heart,” so long as you practice temperancy. 

💥Today's article, which is actually derived from a chapter of a  Eat, Drink, and be Gorgeous: A Nutritionist's Guide to Living Well While Living It Up written by expert nutritionist @gorgeousesther , details how to drink responsibly and recover like a champ, along with the best and worst alcohols to consume and much more!

Click the link in my bio to dive into the full article. I'd also love to hear from you...What is your relationship with alcohol like? How do you naturally combat any hangover symptoms? Feel free to comment below.
